content.location: This route is the second crack in the North Wall.  It is to the right of Hitch Hike.

content.description: Short jam crack that leads to Balanced Rock
content.location: To the right of Balanced Rock you can find this climb. you can either down climb just below balanced rock to get here or rappell from the right and just toprope this location.

content.description: The crux is over the small overhang 3/4 the way up the route.
content.protection: The route requires a standard set of cams up to BD #3.  The #3 BD is a great first piece.  There is also opportunities for nut placements
content.location: This route is the first left crack on the North Wall.  It is just to the right of Balanced Climb.

content.description: Stay inside the corner. Climb past projecting chockstone or traverse let to Balanced Rock.  the route has solid hands and feet.  There are plenty of options to get to the top.  It is not climbed often and is a little dirty.
content.protection: There are plenty of places to place protection.  A standard rack of cams up to a BD #3 is sufficient for the climb.  While rated as a 5.4 I would not recommend it for a first trad lead.  The stances for placing pro are a little tricky.

content.description: Long climb at the mouth of the Box Canyon.
content.location: First route on the right (#23 in the third edition of Swartling & Mayer), when you enter the Box Canyon.

content.description: It is a nice face climb.  There is no defined crux.
content.location: This route is located 5 feet right of Gargoyle.  It is the smooth face climb between Gargoyle and Hitch Hike.

content.description: A nice little secluded canyon just east of the Balanced Rock, and above and behind Balanced Rock Wall.  Several easier leads with thoughtful moves, or a great place to set a couple topropes for kids and newer climbers.
